text:
Question 115) The Atlantic Forest is characterized by a great diversity of epicities, such as bromeliads. These plants are adapted to this ecosystem and can capture light, water and nutrients even living on the trees.
These species capture water from (a)
A) Organism of neighboring plants.
B) Solo through its long roots.
C) Rain accumulated between its leaves.
D) gross sap of host plants.
E) community that lives inside.
